Container.Name: UniFi Protect Backup
Container.Overview:
A Python based tool for backing up UniFi Protect event clips as they occur to cloud storage.
You will need to place a rclone configuration file at `/mnt/user/appdata/unifi-protect-backup/rclone.conf`. You can either copy this from a rclone installation on your machine, or you can creat one with a docker container as described here: https://github.com/ep1cman/unifi-protect-backup#docker-container

Config.Name: TimeZone
Config.Description: TimeZone for the container refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones for a list of possible timezones

Config.Name: UniFi Protect username
Config.Description: Username to login to Unifi Protect instance

Config.Name: Verify SSL certificate
Config.Description: Set to false if your UniFi protect instances doesn't have a valid SSL certificate

Config.Name: Clip retention period
Config.Description: How long should event clips be backed up for. Format as per the `--max-age` argument of `rclone` (https://rclone.org/filtering/#max-age-don-t-transfer-any-file-older-than-this)

Config.Name: rclone destination
Config.Description: `rclone` destination path in the format {rclone remote}:{path on remote}. E.g.`gdrive:/backups/unifi_protect`

Config.Name: Ignore Cameras
Config.Description: IDs of the cameras you want unifi-protect-backup to ignore. A list of camera IDs will be appear at the start of the log
